This is a misunderstanding of both federal and actual practice. The federal law requires broadcasting networks to manage political candidates ' advertisements without examining them for lies or lies. The law itself does not apply to cable networks, but these networks are generally also intended to manage such advertising, as experts have told us. Warren has the point that federal law does not apply to social networks on the Internet such as Facebook, so Facebook can take candidate advertising regardless of whether it contains lies. But generally speaking, it is inaccurate to say that "most networks" will refuse to broadcast an ad by Trump with a lie in it.
